alert.note: Alert for Marengo; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 2:43AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Marengo and southwestern Sumter Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 243 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kinterbish, or 7 miles southeast of Cuba, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... York, Linden, Cuba, Jefferson, Sweet Water, Myrtlewood, Putnam, Freddie Jones Field, Pin Hook, Nanafalia, Miller, Kinterbish, Chickasaw State Park, Wayne, Half Acre, Old Mallard Airport, U.S. 80 and AL 28, Octagon, Nicholsville and Calvary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for southwestern and west central Alabama.
